cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then forecast to turn north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Big Bend, remaining well east of Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key–Indian Pass area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from the middle of Longboat Key, FL to Indian Pass, FL; Storm Surge Warning Englewood, FL to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected along Florida’s west coast and Big Bend; lesser impacts possible along the southeast U.S. coast to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.wind: Minor threat; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤4% chance). Breezy conditions and isolated gusts possible Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Alabama coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may produce 1–2 inches of rain, locally higher, mainly Wednesday–early Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Alabama beaches beginning mid-week.
